arm_group.description: Levosimendan 0.2 ug/kg/min intravenous for a single 7 hours.
Similar coloured placebo intravenous for a single 7 hours

brief_summary.textblock:
Levosimendan is a relatively new drug that improves cardiac contractility in patients with
      heart failure. Its main mechanism of action is enhanced binding of calcium to the myocardial
      contractile proteins. Recent data from our lab showed that levosimendan improves
      contractility of human diaphragm in vitro (muscle fibers from COPD patient diaphragm) and in
      vivo (healthy subjects). Accordingly, levosimendan may appear of value in the treatment of
      disorders associated with impaired respiratory muscle function, such as mechanically
      ventilated patients.We hypothesize that levosimendan could improve respiratory muscle
      function in mechanically ventilated patients commencing a CPAP trial.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Levosimendan on Diaphragm Function in Mechanically Ventilated Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  mechanical ventilation > 3 days

          -  informed consent

          -  able to sustain a CPAP trial for 30 minutes

          -  PaO2/FiO2 ratio > 200 mmHg

          -  ventilatory settings: positive end expiratory pressure <= 10 cmH2O,    pressure
             support <= 10 cmH2O

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pre-existent muscle disease (congenital or acquired) or diseases/disorders known to
             be associated with myopathy including auto-immune diseases

          -  pre-existent cardiac disease (based on history, electrocardiography and transthoracic
             echocardiography)

          -  upper airway/esophageal pathology (i.e. recent surgery, esophageal varices,
             diaphragmatic hernia)

          -  phrenic nerve lesions

          -  pregnancy, breast feeding

          -  severe renal failure (serum creatinine > 150 umol/L)

          -  severe hepatic failure

          -  recent (within 5 days) nasal bleeding

          -  systolic blood pressure < 120 mmHg

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Levosimendan on Diaphragm Function in Mechanically Ventilated Patients

authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure is the neuro-mechanical efficiency(i.e. the ratio of diaphragm electrical activity and transdiaphragmatic pressure) of the diaphragm during a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Artefact-free periode in the last 10 minutes of each CPAP trial

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary outcome measure is the neuro-ventilatory efficiency (i.e. the ratio of diaphragm electrical activity and tidal volume) during a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Artefact-free periode in the last 10 minutes of each CPAP trial

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary outcome measure is the oxygen consumption during a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Artefact-free periode in the last 10 minutes of each CPAP trial

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary outcome measure is the PaO2 at the end of a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
secondary_outcome.measure: Partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Last minute of the 30 minute CPAP trial

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects of levosimendan on accessory respiratory muscle function, ventilator settings are adapted after the last CPAP-trial.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured during a one hour protocol after the second CPAP trial.

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary outcome measure is the carbon dioxide production during a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Artefact-free periode in the last 10 minutes of each CPAP trial

secondary_outcome.description: A secondary outcome measure is the PaCO2 at the and of a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) trial.
secondary_outcome.measure: Partial pressure of carbon dioxide in arterial blood (PaCO2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Last minute of the 30 minute CPAP trial

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
